title: Sort Colors

videos.title: L12. Sort an array of 0's 1's and 2's

patternTriggers: Three-way partitioning + in-place = Dutch National Flag (Three Pointers). Partition into three sections.

approaches.name: Brute Force (Built-in Sort)
approaches.intuition: Simply use built-in sorting algorithm to sort the array.
approaches.approach: Apply any sorting algorithm (quicksort, mergesort, etc.) to sort array.
steps: Array will be sorted with 0s, 1s, 2s in order

complexity.spaceExplanation: Depends on sorting algorithm (quicksort O(log n) stack)

approaches.name: Better (Counting Sort)
approaches.intuition: Count occurrences of 0, 1, 2, then overwrite array with counted values.
approaches.approach: Two-pass: first count each value, then fill array based on counts.
steps: First pass: count occurrences of each value

approaches.name: Dutch National Flag - Optimal
approaches.intuition: Use three pointers: low for 0s boundary, mid for current element, high for 2s boundary. Partition array into [0s][1s][2s] in one pass.
approaches.approach: Three pointers divide array. Swap elements to appropriate sections based on value.

commonMistakes: Incrementing mid after swapping with high
Using counting sort (valid but not one-pass)
Moving mid when swapping with high (unknown value comes from right)
hints: Mid pointer scans, low and high are boundaries
When swapping with high, don't move mid yet
Why? Element from high is unknown, needs checking
followUp: What if there are k colors?
